00071 EQUIPMENT equipment[] = {
00072     {"Crate ",                 /* equipment name */
00073      {1000, TRIGGER_ALL,       /* event ID, trigger mask */
00074       "BUF",                      /* event buffer */
00075       EQ_POLLED | EQ_EB,        /* equipment type */
00076       LAM_SOURCE(0, 0xFFFFFF),  /* event source crate 0, all stations */
00077       "MIDAS",                  /* format */
00078       TRUE,                     /* enabled */
00079       RO_RUNNING,               /* read only when running */
00080       500,                      /* poll for 500ms */
00081       0,                        /* stop run after this event limit */
00082       0,                        /* number of sub events */
00083       0,                        /* don't log history */
00084       "", "", ""},
00085      read_trigger_event,        /* readout routine */

00146 /*
00147  * frontend_early_init:  Called before most MIDAS subsystems are initialized,
00148  *                       so we can set the name (etc.) of the frontend here.
00149  */
00150 INT frontend_early_init()
00151 {
00152   // Determine our crate ID by comparing against a list of hostnames
00153 
00154   char *hostnames[] = {"fe1", "fe2", "fe3", "turtle", "fe5", "fe6"};
00155   int crate_numbers[] = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6};
00156   BOOL crate_has_periodic[] = {FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE};
00157 
00158   int num_hostnames = sizeof(hostnames)/sizeof(char *);
00159   char my_hostname[256];
00160 
00161   gethostname(my_hostname, sizeof(my_hostname));
00162 
00163   BOOL has_periodic = FALSE; 
00164   for(int i = 0; i < num_hostnames; i++) {
00165     if(!strcmp(my_hostname, hostnames[i])) {
00166       crate_number = crate_numbers[i];
00167       has_periodic = crate_has_periodic[i];
00168     }
00169   }
00170 
00171   if(crate_number > 0) {
00172     frontend_name = new char[32];
00173     strcpy(frontend_name, "Crate ");
00174 
00175 #if 0
00176     sprintf(equipment[0].name, "Crate %d", crate_number);
00177     sprintf(equipment[0].info.buffer, "BUF%d", crate_number);
00178     equipment[0].info.event_id = 1000 + crate_number;
00179 #endif
00180     frontend_index = crate_number;
00181 
00182     if(has_periodic) {
00183       sprintf(equipment[1].name, "Periodic %d", crate_number);
00184       equipment[1].info.event_id = 2000 + crate_number;
00185     } else {
00186       sprintf(equipment[1].name, "");
00187     }
00188   } 
00189  
00190   return SUCCESS;
00191 }

00193 /* ********************************************************************* */
00194 /*
00195  * frontend_init:  When the frontend program is started. This routine
00196  *                 should initialize the hardware.
00197  */
00198 INT frontend_init()
00199 {
00200   INT run_state = odb_get_int("/Runinfo/State");
00201   if (run_state != STATE_STOPPED) {
00202     cm_msg(MERROR, "Crate",
00203             "Run must be stopped before starting crate program.");
00204     return FE_ERR_HW;
00205   }
00206 
00207   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00208     if((*trigger_modules[i]).init != NULL) {
00209       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).init();
00210       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00211         return status;
00212       }
00213     }
00214   }
00215 
00216   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00217     if((*periodic_modules[i]).init != NULL) {
00218       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).init();
00219       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00220         return status;
00221       }
00222     }
00223   }
00224 
00225 
00226   return SUCCESS;
00227 }
00228 
00229 /* ********************************************************************* */
00230 /*
00231  * frontend_exit:  When the frontend program is shut down. Can be used
00232  *                 to release any locked resources like memory, commu-
00233  *                 nications ports etc.
00234  */
00235 INT frontend_exit()
00236 {
00237   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00238     if((*trigger_modules[i]).exit != NULL) {
00239       (*trigger_modules[i]).exit();
00240     }
00241   }
00242 
00243   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00244     if((*periodic_modules[i]).exit != NULL) {
00245       (*periodic_modules[i]).exit();
00246     }
00247   }
00248 
00249   return SUCCESS;
00250 }

00252 /*
00253  * pre_begin_of_run:   Called before a new run is started. 
00254  */
00255 INT pre_begin_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00256 {
00257   diag_print(1, "*** Before begin of run %d ***\n", run_number);
00258 
00259   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00260     if((*trigger_modules[i]).pre_bor != NULL) {
00261       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).pre_bor();
00262       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00263         return status;
00264       }
00265     }
00266   }
00267 
00268   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00269     if((*periodic_modules[i]).pre_bor != NULL) {
00270       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).pre_bor();
00271       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00272         return status;
00273       }
00274     }
00275   }
00276 
00277 
00278   return SUCCESS;
00279 }

00281 /* ********************************************************************* */
00282 /*
00283  * begin_of_run:   When a new run is started. Clear scalers, open
00284  *                 rungates, etc.
00285  */
00286 INT begin_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00287 {
00288   diag_print(1, "*** Begin of run %d ***\n", run_number);
00289 
00290   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00291     if((*trigger_modules[i]).bor != NULL) {
00292       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).bor();
00293       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00294         return status;
00295       }
00296     }
00297   }
00298 
00299   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00300     if((*periodic_modules[i]).bor != NULL) {
00301       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).bor();
00302       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00303         return status;
00304       }
00305     }
00306   }
00307 
00308   cycle_active = 0;
00309   event_avail = false;
00310 
00311   between_runs = false;
00312 
00313   return SUCCESS;
00314 }
00315 
00316 /* ********************************************************************* */
00317 /*
00318  * end_of_run:     Called on a request to stop a run. Can send
00319  *                 end-of-run event and close run gates.
00320  */
00321 INT end_of_run(INT run_number, char *error)
00322 {
00323   diag_print(1, "*** End of run %d ***\n", run_number);
00324 
00325   between_runs = true;
00326 
00327   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00328     if((*trigger_modules[i]).eor != NULL) {
00329       int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).eor();
00330       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00331         return status;
00332       }
00333     }
00334   }
00335 
00336   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00337     if((*periodic_modules[i]).eor != NULL) {
00338       int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).eor();
00339       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00340         return status;
00341       }
00342     }
00343   }
00344 
00345 
00346   return SUCCESS;
00347 }

00367 /* ********************************************************************* */
00368 /*
00369  * start_cycle
00370  */
00371 void start_cycle()
00372 {
00373   struct timeval restart_time;
00374   gettimeofday(&restart_time, NULL);
00375 
00376   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00377     if((*trigger_modules[i]).start_cycle != NULL) {
00378       (*trigger_modules[i]).start_cycle();
00379     }
00380   }
00381 
00382   diag_print(2, "Waited %f microseconds for restart.\n", 
00383     (restart_time.tv_sec-readout_finished_time.tv_sec)*1e6 +
00384       (restart_time.tv_usec-readout_finished_time.tv_usec));
00385 
00386   cycle_active = 1;
00387 }
00388 
00389 /*
00390  * consider_start
00391  */
00392 INT consider_start()
00393 {
00394     for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00395       if((*trigger_modules[i]).poll_dead != NULL) {
00396         int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).poll_dead();
00397 
00398         if(status == FE_NEED_START && !event_avail) {
00399           start_cycle();
00400         } else if(status != SUCCESS) {
00401           return status;
00402         }
00403       }
00404     }
00405 
00406 }
00407 
00408 /*
00409  * stop_cycle
00410  */
00411 void stop_cycle()
00412 {
00413   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00414     if((*trigger_modules[i]).stop_cycle != NULL) {
00415       (*trigger_modules[i]).stop_cycle();
00416     }
00417   }
00418 }

00420 /* ********************************************************************* */
00421 /* 
00422  * If frontend_call_loop is true, this routine gets called when
00423  * the frontend is idle or once between every event 
00424  */ 
00425 INT frontend_loop()
00426 {
00427   // If we're going to be pre-empted, get it over with during livetime
00428   // rather than deadtime.
00429   if (cycle_active || run_state != STATE_RUNNING || between_runs == TRUE) { 
00430     dm_area_flush();
00431     sched_yield();
00432   }
00433 
00434   // Exit immediately if no run in progress
00435   if (run_state != STATE_RUNNING || between_runs == TRUE) {
00436     return SUCCESS;
00437   }
00438 
00439   // Call appropriate poll functions, depending on whether we're live or dead
00440   if (cycle_active) { 
00441 
00442     for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00443       if((*trigger_modules[i]).poll_live != NULL) {
00444 
00445         // There are conditions that can lead to changes in run state between
00446         // modules...
00447         if (run_state != STATE_RUNNING || between_runs == TRUE) {
00448           return SUCCESS;
00449         }
00450         int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).poll_live();
00451 
00452         if(status == FE_END_BLOCK) {
00453           cycle_active = 0;
00454           event_avail = true;
00455         } else if(status == FE_NEED_STOP) {
00456           stop_cycle(); 
00457         } else if(status != SUCCESS) {
00458           return status;
00459         }
00460       }
00461     }
00462   } else {
00463     consider_start();
00464   }
00465 
00466   return SUCCESS;
00467 }
00468 
00469 /* ********************************************************************* */
00470 /* 
00471  * Polling routine for events. Returns TRUE if event
00472  * is available. If test equals TRUE, don't return. The test
00473  * flag is used to time the polling.
00474  */
00475 INT poll_event(INT source, INT count, BOOL test)
00476 {
00477     INT retval = false;
00478 
00479     if(!test) {
00480       count = 1;
00481     }
00482 
00483     for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
00484         frontend_loop();
00485         if(event_avail) {
00486           retval = true;
00487         }
00488     }
00489 
00490     return retval;
00491 }
00492 
00493 /* ********************************************************************* */
00494 INT interrupt_configure(INT cmd, INT source, PTYPE adr)
00495 {
00496     switch (cmd) {
00497     case CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE:
00498         interrupts_enabled = TRUE;
00499         break;
00500     case CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE:
00501         interrupts_enabled = FALSE;
00502         break;
00503     case CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH:
00504         interrupt_handler = (void (*)(void)) adr;
00505         break;
00506     case CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH:
00507         interrupts_enabled = FALSE;
00508         interrupt_handler = NULL;
00509         break;
00510     }
00511     return SUCCESS;
00512 }
00513 
00514 void print_diag_output(char *pevent)
00515 {
00516   printf("--------\n"); 
00517 
00518   printf("Event number: %d\n", (((EVENT_HEADER *)pevent)-1)->serial_number);
00519 
00520   BANK32 *pbk = NULL; 
00521   do {
00522     DWORD *pdata; 
00523     int size = bk_iterate32(pevent, &pbk, &pdata);
00524     if(pbk != NULL) {
00525       printf("%c%c%c%c\t%d\t\t", pbk->name[0], pbk->name[1], pbk->name[2],
00526         pbk->name[3], size);
00527       for(int i = 0; i < MIN(4, size/4); i++) {
00528          printf("0x%08x ", pdata[i]); 
00529       }
00530       printf("\n");
00531     }
00532   } while(pbk != NULL);
00533 
00534   printf("--------\n"); 
00535 }
00536 
00537 /* ********************************************************************* */
00538 INT read_trigger_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00539 {
00540   diag_print(2, "Event has ended.  Executing read_trigger_event.\n");
00541 
00542   // Remember that we have read out this event
00543   event_avail = false;
00544 
00545   // Initialize the event
00546   bk_init32(pevent);
00547 
00548   // Protection against readout after run has ended.
00549   if (run_state != STATE_RUNNING) {
00550     diag_print(1, "Readout after end of run!!!\n");
00551     return bk_size(pevent);
00552   }
00553 
00554   struct timeval readout_start_time;
00555   gettimeofday(&readout_start_time, NULL);
00556   // Ask trigger_modules to read out
00557   for(int i = 0; i < num_trigger_modules; i++) {
00558      if((*trigger_modules[i]).read != NULL) {
00559        int status = (*trigger_modules[i]).read(pevent);
00560        if(status != SUCCESS) {
00561          return status;
00562        }
00563     }
00564   }
00565   gettimeofday(&readout_finished_time, NULL);
00566   diag_print(2, "Spent %f microseconds for readout.\n", 
00567     (readout_finished_time.tv_sec-readout_start_time.tv_sec)*1e6 +
00568       (readout_finished_time.tv_usec-readout_start_time.tv_usec));
00569 
00570   // Consider starting up the next block
00571   consider_start();
00572 
00573   // Print a diagnostic
00574   if(diag_print_threshold >= 2) {
00575     print_diag_output(pevent);
00576   }
00577 
00578   return bk_size(pevent);
00579 }
00580 
00581 /* ********************************************************************* */
00582 INT read_periodic_event(char *pevent, INT off)
00583 {
00584   diag_print(2, "Periodic event readout:\n");
00585 
00586   // Initialize the event
00587   bk_init32(pevent);
00588 
00589   // Ask periodic_modules to read out
00590   for(int i = 0; i < num_periodic_modules; i++) {
00591      if((*periodic_modules[i]).read != NULL) {
00592        int status = (*periodic_modules[i]).read(pevent);
00593        if(status != SUCCESS) {
00594          return status;
00595        }
00596     }
00597   }
00598 
00599   // Print a diagnostic
00600   if(diag_print_threshold >= 2) {
00601     print_diag_output(pevent);
00602   }
00603 
00604 
00605   return bk_size(pevent);
00606 }
